intro: Thoracosperma parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered tamanu, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers and palmate leaves. The plant produces a latex sap that has been traditionally used for its medicinal properties. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to habitat loss, it is considered vulnerable and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
